16172  return QPolygonF(); // don't have same axis orientation, can't fill that (Note: if keyAxis fits, valueAxis will fit too, because it's always orthogonal to keyAxis)
16173 
16174  if (lineData->isEmpty()) return QPolygonF();
16175  QVector<QPointF> otherData;
16176  mChannelFillGraph.data()->getPlotData(&otherData, 0);
16177  if (otherData.isEmpty()) return QPolygonF();
16178  QVector<QPointF> thisData;
16179  thisData.reserve(lineData->size()+otherData.size()); // because we will join both vectors at end of this function
16180  for (int i=0; i<lineData->size(); ++i) // don't use the vector<<(vector), it squeezes internally, which ruins the performance tuning with reserve()
16181  thisData << lineData->at(i);
16182 
16183  // pointers to be able to swap them, depending which data range needs cropping:
16184  QVector<QPointF> *staticData = &thisData;
16185  QVector<QPointF> *croppedData = &otherData;
16186 
16187  // crop both vectors to ranges in which the keys overlap (which coord is key, depends on axisType):
16188  if (keyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Horizontal)
16189  {
16190  // x is key
16191  // if an axis range is reversed, the data point keys will be descending. Reverse them, since following algorithm assumes ascending keys:
16192  if (staticData->first().x() > staticData->last().x())
16193  {
16194  int size = staticData->size();
16195  for (int i=0; i<size/2; ++i)
16196  qSwap((*staticData)[i], (*staticData)[size-1-i]);
16197  }
16198  if (croppedData->first().x() > croppedData->last().x())
16199  {
16200  int size = croppedData->size();
16201  for (int i=0; i<size/2; ++i)
16202  qSwap((*croppedData)[i], (*croppedData)[size-1-i]);
16203  }
16204  // crop lower bound:
16205  if (staticData->first().x() < croppedData->first().x()) // other one must be cropped
16206  qSwap(staticData, croppedData);
16207  int lowBound = findIndexBelowX(croppedData, staticData->first().x());
16208  if (lowBound == -1) return QPolygonF(); // key ranges have no overlap
16209  croppedData->remove(0, lowBound);
16210  // set lowest point of cropped data to fit exactly key position of first static data
16211  // point via linear interpolation:
16212  if (croppedData->size() < 2) return QPolygonF(); // need at least two points for interpolation
16213  double slope;
16214  if (croppedData->at(1).x()-croppedData->at(0).x() != 0)
16215  slope = (croppedData->at(1).y()-croppedData->at(0).y())/(croppedData->at(1).x()-croppedData->at(0).x());
16216  else
16217  slope = 0;
16218  (*croppedData)[0].setY(croppedData->at(0).y()+slope*(staticData->first().x()-croppedData->at(0).x()));
16219  (*croppedData)[0].setX(staticData->first().x());
16220 
16221  // crop upper bound:
16222  if (staticData->last().x() > croppedData->last().x()) // other one must be cropped
16223  qSwap(staticData, croppedData);
16224  int highBound = findIndexAboveX(croppedData, staticData->last().x());
16225  if (highBound == -1) return QPolygonF(); // key ranges have no overlap
16226  croppedData->remove(highBound+1, croppedData->size()-(highBound+1));
16227  // set highest point of cropped data to fit exactly key position of last static data
16228  // point via linear interpolation:
16229  if (croppedData->size() < 2) return QPolygonF(); // need at least two points for interpolation
16230  int li = croppedData->size()-1; // last index
16231  if (croppedData->at(li).x()-croppedData->at(li-1).x() != 0)
16232  slope = (croppedData->at(li).y()-croppedData->at(li-1).y())/(croppedData->at(li).x()-croppedData->at(li-1).x());
16233  else
16234  slope = 0;
16235  (*croppedData)[li].setY(croppedData->at(li-1).y()+slope*(staticData->last().x()-croppedData->at(li-1).x()));
16236  (*croppedData)[li].setX(staticData->last().x());
16237  } else // mKeyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical
16238  {
16239  // y is key
16240  // similar to "x is key" but switched x,y. Further, lower/upper meaning is inverted compared to x,
16241  // because in pixel coordinates, y increases from top to bottom, not bottom to top like data coordinate.
16242  // if an axis range is reversed, the data point keys will be descending. Reverse them, since following algorithm assumes ascending keys:
16243  if (staticData->first().y() < staticData->last().y())
16244  {
16245  int size = staticData->size();
16246  for (int i=0; i<size/2; ++i)
16247  qSwap((*staticData)[i], (*staticData)[size-1-i]);
16248  }
16249  if (croppedData->first().y() < croppedData->last().y())
16250  {
16251  int size = croppedData->size();
16252  for (int i=0; i<size/2; ++i)
16253  qSwap((*croppedData)[i], (*croppedData)[size-1-i]);
16254  }
16255  // crop lower bound:
16256  if (staticData->first().y() > croppedData->first().y()) // other one must be cropped
16257  qSwap(staticData, croppedData);
16258  int lowBound = findIndexAboveY(croppedData, staticData->first().y());
16259  if (lowBound == -1) return QPolygonF(); // key ranges have no overlap
16260  croppedData->remove(0, lowBound);
16261  // set lowest point of cropped data to fit exactly key position of first static data
16262  // point via linear interpolation:
16263  if (croppedData->size() < 2) return QPolygonF(); // need at least two points for interpolation
16264  double slope;
16265  if (croppedData->at(1).y()-croppedData->at(0).y() != 0) // avoid division by zero in step plots
16266  slope = (croppedData->at(1).x()-croppedData->at(0).x())/(croppedData->at(1).y()-croppedData->at(0).y());
16267  else
16268  slope = 0;
16269  (*croppedData)[0].setX(croppedData->at(0).x()+slope*(staticData->first().y()-croppedData->at(0).y()));
16270  (*croppedData)[0].setY(staticData->first().y());
16271 
16272  // crop upper bound:
16273  if (staticData->last().y() < croppedData->last().y()) // other one must be cropped
16274  qSwap(staticData, croppedData);
16275  int highBound = findIndexBelowY(croppedData, staticData->last().y());
16276  if (highBound == -1) return QPolygonF(); // key ranges have no overlap
16277  croppedData->remove(highBound+1, croppedData->size()-(highBound+1));
16278  // set highest point of cropped data to fit exactly key position of last static data
16279  // point via linear interpolation:
16280  if (croppedData->size() < 2) return QPolygonF(); // need at least two points for interpolation
16281  int li = croppedData->size()-1; // last index
16282  if (croppedData->at(li).y()-croppedData->at(li-1).y() != 0) // avoid division by zero in step plots
16283  slope = (croppedData->at(li).x()-croppedData->at(li-1).x())/(croppedData->at(li).y()-croppedData->at(li-1).y());
16284  else
16285  slope = 0;
16286  (*croppedData)[li].setX(croppedData->at(li-1).x()+slope*(staticData->last().y()-croppedData->at(li-1).y()));
16287  (*croppedData)[li].setY(staticData->last().y());
16288  }
16289 
16290  // return joined:
16291  for (int i=otherData.size()-1; i>=0; --i) // insert reversed, otherwise the polygon will be twisted
16292  thisData << otherData.at(i);
16293  return QPolygonF(thisData);
16294 }
16295 
16303 int QCPGraph::findIndexAboveX(const QVector<QPointF> *data, double x) const
16304 {
16305  for (int i=data->size()-1; i>=0; --i)
16306  {
16307  if (data->at(i).x() < x)
16308  {
16309  if (i<data->size()-1)
16310  return i+1;
16311  else
16312  return data->size()-1;
16313  }
16314  }
16315  return -1;
16316 }
16317 
16325 int QCPGraph::findIndexBelowX(const QVector<QPointF> *data, double x) const
16326 {
16327  for (int i=0; i<data->size(); ++i)
16328  {
16329  if (data->at(i).x() > x)
16330  {
16331  if (i>0)
16332  return i-1;
16333  else
16334  return 0;
16335  }
16336  }
16337  return -1;
16338 }
16339 
16347 int QCPGraph::findIndexAboveY(const QVector<QPointF> *data, double y) const
16348 {
16349  for (int i=0; i<data->size(); ++i)
16350  {
16351  if (data->at(i).y() < y)
16352  {
16353  if (i>0)
16354  return i-1;
16355  else
16356  return 0;
16357  }
16358  }
16359  return -1;
16360 }
16361 
16372 double QCPGraph::pointDistance(const QPointF &pixelPoint) const
16373 {
16374  if (mData->isEmpty())
16375  {
16376  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "requested point distance on graph" << mName << "without data";
16377  return 500;
16378  }
16379  if (mData->size() == 1)
16380  {
16381  QPointF dataPoint = coordsToPixels(mData->constBegin().key(), mData->constBegin().value().value);
16382  return QVector2D(dataPoint-pixelPoint).length();
16383  }
16384 
16385  if (mLineStyle == lsNone && mScatterStyle.isNone())
16386  return 500;
16387 
16388  // calculate minimum distances to graph representation:
16389  if (mLineStyle == lsNone)
16390  {
16391  // no line displayed, only calculate distance to scatter points:
16392  QVector<QCPData> *scatterData = new QVector<QCPData>;
16393  getScatterPlotData(scatterData);
16394  double minDistSqr = std::numeric_limits<double>::max();
16395  QPointF ptA;
16396  QPointF ptB = coordsToPixels(scatterData->at(0).key, scatterData->at(0).value); // getScatterPlotData returns in plot coordinates, so transform to pixels
16397  for (int i=1; i<scatterData->size(); ++i)
16398  {
16399  ptA = ptB;
16400  ptB = coordsToPixels(scatterData->at(i).key, scatterData->at(i).value);
16401  double currentDistSqr = distSqrToLine(ptA, ptB, pixelPoint);
16402  if (currentDistSqr < minDistSqr)
16403  minDistSqr = currentDistSqr;
16404  }
16405  delete scatterData;
16406  return sqrt(minDistSqr);
16407  } else
16408  {
16409  // line displayed calculate distance to line segments:
16410  QVector<QPointF> *lineData = new QVector<QPointF>;
16411  getPlotData(lineData, 0); // unlike with getScatterPlotData we get pixel coordinates here
16412  double minDistSqr = std::numeric_limits<double>::max();
16413  if (mLineStyle == lsImpulse)
16414  {
16415  // impulse plot differs from other line styles in that the lineData points are only pairwise connected:
16416  for (int i=0; i<lineData->size()-1; i+=2) // iterate pairs
16417  {
16418  double currentDistSqr = distSqrToLine(lineData->at(i), lineData->at(i+1), pixelPoint);
16419  if (currentDistSqr < minDistSqr)
16420  minDistSqr = currentDistSqr;
16421  }
16422  } else
16423  {
16424  // all other line plots (line and step) connect points directly:
16425  for (int i=0; i<lineData->size()-1; ++i)
16426  {
16427  double currentDistSqr = distSqrToLine(lineData->at(i), lineData->at(i+1), pixelPoint);
16428  if (currentDistSqr < minDistSqr)
16429  minDistSqr = currentDistSqr;
16430  }
16431  }
16432  delete lineData;
16433  return sqrt(minDistSqr);
16434  }
16435 }
16436 
16445 int QCPGraph::findIndexBelowY(const QVector<QPointF> *data, double y) const
16446 {
16447  for (int i=data->size()-1; i>=0; --i)
16448  {
16449  if (data->at(i).y() > y)
16450  {
16451  if (i<data->size()-1)
16452  return i+1;
16453  else
16454  return data->size()-1;
16455  }
16456  }
16457  return -1;
16458 }
16459 
16460 /* inherits documentation from base class */
16461 QCPRange QCPGraph::getKeyRange(bool &foundRange, SignDomain inSignDomain) const
16462 {
16463  // just call the specialized version which takes an additional argument whether error bars
16464  // should also be taken into consideration for range calculation. We set this to true here.
16465  return getKeyRange(foundRange, inSignDomain, true);
16466 }
16467 
16468 /* inherits documentation from base class */
16469 QCPRange QCPGraph::getValueRange(bool &foundRange, SignDomain inSignDomain) const
16470 {
16471  // just call the specialized version which takes an additional argument whether error bars
16472  // should also be taken into consideration for range calculation. We set this to true here.
16473  return getValueRange(foundRange, inSignDomain, true);
16474 }
16475 
16482 QCPRange QCPGraph::getKeyRange(bool &foundRange, SignDomain inSignDomain, bool includeErrors) const
16483 {
16484  QCPRange range;
16485  bool haveLower = false;
16486  bool haveUpper = false;
16487 
16488  double current, currentErrorMinus, currentErrorPlus;
16489 
16490  if (inSignDomain == sdBoth) // range may be anywhere
16491  {
16492  QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = mData->constBegin();
16493  while (it != mData->constEnd())
16494  {
16495  current = it.value().key;
16496  currentErrorMinus = (includeErrors ? it.value().keyErrorMinus : 0);
16497  currentErrorPlus = (includeErrors ? it.value().keyErrorPlus : 0);
16498  if (current-currentErrorMinus < range.lower || !haveLower)
16499  {
16500  range.lower = current-currentErrorMinus;
16501  haveLower = true;
16502  }
16503  if (current+currentErrorPlus > range.upper || !haveUpper)
16504  {
16505  range.upper = current+currentErrorPlus;
16506  haveUpper = true;
16507  }
16508  ++it;
16509  }
16510  } else if (inSignDomain == sdNegative) // range may only be in the negative sign domain
16511  {
16512  QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = mData->constBegin();
16513  while (it != mData->constEnd())
16514  {
16515  current = it.value().key;
16516  currentErrorMinus = (includeErrors ? it.value().keyErrorMinus : 0);
16517  currentErrorPlus = (includeErrors ? it.value().keyErrorPlus : 0);
16518  if ((current-currentErrorMinus < range.lower || !haveLower) && current-currentErrorMinus < 0)
16519  {
16520  range.lower = current-currentErrorMinus;
16521  haveLower = true;
16522  }
16523  if ((current+currentErrorPlus > range.upper || !haveUpper) && current+currentErrorPlus < 0)
16524  {
16525  range.upper = current+currentErrorPlus;
16526  haveUpper = true;
16527  }
16528  if (includeErrors) // in case point is in valid sign domain but errobars stretch beyond it, we still want to geht that point.
16529  {
16530  if ((current < range.lower || !haveLower) && current < 0)
16531  {
16532  range.lower = current;
16533  haveLower = true;
16534  }
16535  if ((current > range.upper || !haveUpper) && current < 0)
16536  {
16537  range.upper = current;
16538  haveUpper = true;
16539  }
16540  }
16541  ++it;
16542  }
16543  } else if (inSignDomain == sdPositive) // range may only be in the positive sign domain
16544  {
16545  QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = mData->constBegin();
16546  while (it != mData->constEnd())
16547  {
16548  current = it.value().key;
16549  currentErrorMinus = (includeErrors ? it.value().keyErrorMinus : 0);
16550  currentErrorPlus = (includeErrors ? it.value().keyErrorPlus : 0);
16551  if ((current-currentErrorMinus < range.lower || !haveLower) && current-currentErrorMinus > 0)
16552  {
16553  range.lower = current-currentErrorMinus;
16554  haveLower = true;
16555  }
16556  if ((current+currentErrorPlus > range.upper || !haveUpper) && current+currentErrorPlus > 0)
16557  {
16558  range.upper = current+currentErrorPlus;
16559  haveUpper = true;
16560  }
16561  if (includeErrors) // in case point is in valid sign domain but errobars stretch beyond it, we still want to get that point.
16562  {
16563  if ((current < range.lower || !haveLower) && current > 0)
16564  {
16565  range.lower = current;
16566  haveLower = true;
16567  }
16568  if ((current > range.upper || !haveUpper) && current > 0)
16569  {
16570  range.upper = current;
16571  haveUpper = true;
16572  }
16573  }
16574  ++it;
16575  }
16576  }
16577 
16578  foundRange = haveLower && haveUpper;
16579  return range;
16580 }
16581 
16588 QCPRange QCPGraph::getValueRange(bool &foundRange, SignDomain inSignDomain, bool includeErrors) const
16589 {
16590  QCPRange range;
16591  bool haveLower = false;
16592  bool haveUpper = false;
16593 
16594  double current, currentErrorMinus, currentErrorPlus;
16595 
16596  if (inSignDomain == sdBoth) // range may be anywhere
16597  {
16598  QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = mData->constBegin();
16599  while (it != mData->constEnd())
16600  {
16601  current = it.value().value;
16602  currentErrorMinus = (includeErrors ? it.value().valueErrorMinus : 0);
16603  currentErrorPlus = (includeErrors ? it.value().valueErrorPlus : 0);
16604  if (current-currentErrorMinus < range.lower || !haveLower)
16605  {
16606  range.lower = current-currentErrorMinus;
16607  haveLower = true;
16608  }
16609  if (current+currentErrorPlus > range.upper || !haveUpper)
16610  {
16611  range.upper = current+currentErrorPlus;
16612  haveUpper = true;
16613  }
16614  ++it;
16615  }
16616  } else if (inSignDomain == sdNegative) // range may only be in the negative sign domain
16617  {
16618  QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = mData->constBegin();
16619  while (it != mData->constEnd())
16620  {
16621  current = it.value().value;
16622  currentErrorMinus = (includeErrors ? it.value().valueErrorMinus : 0);
16623  currentErrorPlus = (includeErrors ? it.value().valueErrorPlus : 0);
16624  if ((current-currentErrorMinus < range.lower || !haveLower) && current-currentErrorMinus < 0)
16625  {
16626  range.lower = current-currentErrorMinus;
16627  haveLower = true;
16628  }
16629  if ((current+currentErrorPlus > range.upper || !haveUpper) && current+currentErrorPlus < 0)
16630  {
16631  range.upper = current+currentErrorPlus;
16632  haveUpper = true;
16633  }
16634  if (includeErrors) // in case point is in valid sign domain but errobars stretch beyond it, we still want to get that point.
16635  {
16636  if ((current < range.lower || !haveLower) && current < 0)
16637  {
16638  range.lower = current;
16639  haveLower = true;
16640  }
16641  if ((current > range.upper || !haveUpper) && current < 0)
16642  {
16643  range.upper = current;
16644  haveUpper = true;
16645  }
16646  }
16647  ++it;
16648  }
16649  } else if (inSignDomain == sdPositive) // range may only be in the positive sign domain
16650  {
16651  QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = mData->constBegin();
16652  while (it != mData->constEnd())
16653  {
16654  current = it.value().value;
16655  currentErrorMinus = (includeErrors ? it.value().valueErrorMinus : 0);
16656  currentErrorPlus = (includeErrors ? it.value().valueErrorPlus : 0);
16657  if ((current-currentErrorMinus < range.lower || !haveLower) && current-currentErrorMinus > 0)
16658  {
16659  range.lower = current-currentErrorMinus;
16660  haveLower = true;
16661  }
16662  if ((current+currentErrorPlus > range.upper || !haveUpper) && current+currentErrorPlus > 0)
16663  {
16664  range.upper = current+currentErrorPlus;
16665  haveUpper = true;
16666  }
16667  if (includeErrors) // in case point is in valid sign domain but errobars stretch beyond it, we still want to geht that point.
16668  {
16669  if ((current < range.lower || !haveLower) && current > 0)
16670  {
16671  range.lower = current;
16672  haveLower = true;
16673  }
16674  if ((current > range.upper || !haveUpper) && current > 0)
16675  {
16676  range.upper = current;
16677  haveUpper = true;
16678  }
16679  }
16680  ++it;
16681  }
16682  }
16683 
16684  foundRange = haveLower && haveUpper;
16685  return range;
16686 }
16687 
16688 
16692 
16709 QCPCurveData::QCPCurveData() :
16710  t(0),
16711  key(0),
16712  value(0)
16713 {
16714 }
16715 
16719 QCPCurveData::QCPCurveData(double t, double key, double value) :
16720  t(t),
16721  key(key),
16722  value(value)
16723 {
16724 }
16725 
16726 
16730 
16772 QCPCurve::QCPCurve(QCPAxis *keyAxis, QCPAxis *valueAxis) :
16773  QCPAbstractPlottable(keyAxis, valueAxis)
16774 {
16775  mData = new QCPCurveDataMap;
16776  mPen.setColor(Qt::blue);
16777  mPen.setStyle(Qt::SolidLine);
16778  mBrush.setColor(Qt::blue);
16779  mBrush.setStyle(Qt::NoBrush);
16780  mSelectedPen = mPen;
16781  mSelectedPen.setWidthF(2.5);
16782  mSelectedPen.setColor(QColor(80, 80, 255)); // lighter than Qt::blue of mPen
16783  mSelectedBrush = mBrush;
16784 
16785  setScatterStyle(QCPScatterStyle());
16786  setLineStyle(lsLine);
16787 }
16788 
16789 QCPCurve::~QCPCurve()
16790 {
16791  delete mData;
16792 }
16793 
16801 void QCPCurve::setData(QCPCurveDataMap *data, bool copy)
16802 {
16803  if (copy)
16804  {
16805  *mData = *data;
16806  } else
16807  {
16808  delete mData;
16809  mData = data;
16810  }
16811 }
16812 
16819 void QCPCurve::setData(const QVector<double> &t, const QVector<double> &key, const QVector<double> &value)
16820 {
16821  mData->clear();
16822  int n = t.size();
16823  n = qMin(n, key.size());
16824  n = qMin(n, value.size());
16825  QCPCurveData newData;
16826  for (int i=0; i<n; ++i)
16827  {
16828  newData.t = t[i];
16829  newData.key = key[i];
16830  newData.value = value[i];
16831  mData->insertMulti(newData.t, newData);
16832  }
16833 }
16834 
16840 void QCPCurve::setData(const QVector<double> &key, const QVector<double> &value)
16841 {
16842  mData->clear();
16843  int n = key.size();
16844  n = qMin(n, value.size());
16845  QCPCurveData newData;
16846  for (int i=0; i<n; ++i)
16847  {
16848  newData.t = i; // no t vector given, so we assign t the index of the key/value pair
16849  newData.key = key[i];
16850  newData.value = value[i];
16851  mData->insertMulti(newData.t, newData);
16852  }
16853 }
16854 
16862 void QCPCurve::setScatterStyle(const QCPScatterStyle &style)
16863 {
16864  mScatterStyle = style;
16865 }
16866 
16874 void QCPCurve::setLineStyle(QCPCurve::LineStyle style)
16875 {
16876  mLineStyle = style;
16877 }
16878 
16883 void QCPCurve::addData(const QCPCurveDataMap &dataMap)
16884 {
16885  mData->unite(dataMap);
16886 }
16887 
16892 void QCPCurve::addData(const QCPCurveData &data)
16893 {
16894  mData->insertMulti(data.t, data);
16895 }
16896 
16901 void QCPCurve::addData(double t, double key, double value)
16902 {
16903  QCPCurveData newData;
16904  newData.t = t;
16905  newData.key = key;
16906  newData.value = value;
16907  mData->insertMulti(newData.t, newData);
16908 }
16909 
16918 void QCPCurve::addData(double key, double value)
16919 {
16920  QCPCurveData newData;
16921  if (!mData->isEmpty())
16922  newData.t = (mData->constEnd()-1).key()+1;
16923  else
16924  newData.t = 0;
16925  newData.key = key;
16926  newData.value = value;
16927  mData->insertMulti(newData.t, newData);
16928 }
16929 
16934 void QCPCurve::addData(const QVector<double> &ts, const QVector<double> &keys, const QVector<double> &values)
16935 {
16936  int n = ts.size();
16937  n = qMin(n, keys.size());
16938  n = qMin(n, values.size());
16939  QCPCurveData newData;
16940  for (int i=0; i<n; ++i)
16941  {
16942  newData.t = ts[i];
16943  newData.key = keys[i];
16944  newData.value = values[i];
16945  mData->insertMulti(newData.t, newData);
16946  }
16947 }
16948 
16953 void QCPCurve::removeDataBefore(double t)
16954 {
16955  QCPCurveDataMap::iterator it = mData->begin();
16956  while (it != mData->end() && it.key() < t)
16957  it = mData->erase(it);
16958 }
16959 
16964 void QCPCurve::removeDataAfter(double t)
16965 {
16966  if (mData->isEmpty()) return;
16967  QCPCurveDataMap::iterator it = mData->upperBound(t);
16968  while (it != mData->end())
16969  it = mData->erase(it);
16970 }
16971 
16979 void QCPCurve::removeData(double fromt, double tot)
16980 {
16981  if (fromt >= tot || mData->isEmpty()) return;
16982  QCPCurveDataMap::iterator it = mData->upperBound(fromt);
16983  QCPCurveDataMap::iterator itEnd = mData->upperBound(tot);
16984  while (it != itEnd)
16985  it = mData->erase(it);
16986 }
16987 
16997 void QCPCurve::removeData(double t)
16998 {
16999  mData->remove(t);
17000 }
17001 
17006 void QCPCurve::clearData()
17007 {
17008  mData->clear();
17009 }
17010 
17011 /* inherits documentation from base class */
17012 double QCPCurve::selectTest(const QPointF &pos, bool onlySelectable, QVariant *details) const
17013 {
17014  Q_UNUSED(details)
17015  if ((onlySelectable && !mSelectable) || mData->isEmpty())
17016  return -1;
17017  if (!mKeyAxis || !mValueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return -1; }
17018 
17019  if (mKeyAxis.data()->axisRect()->rect().contains(pos.toPoint()))
17020  return pointDistance(pos);
17021  else
17022  return -1;
17023 }
17024 
17025 /* inherits documentation from base class */
17026 void QCPCurve::draw(QCPPainter *painter)
17027 {
17028  if (mData->isEmpty()) return;
17029 
17030  // allocate line vector:
17031  QVector<QPointF> *lineData = new QVector<QPointF>;
17032 
17033  // fill with curve data:
17034  getCurveData(lineData);
17035 
17036  // check data validity if flag set:
17037 #ifdef QCUSTOMPLOT_CHECK_DATA
17038  QCPCurveDataMap::const_iterator it;
17039  for (it = mData->constBegin(); it != mData->constEnd(); ++it)
17040  {
17041  if (QCP::isInvalidData(it.value().t) ||
17042  QCP::isInvalidData(it.value().key, it.value().value))
17043  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "Data point at" << it.key() << "invalid." << "Plottable name:" << name();
17044  }
17045 #endif
17046 
17047  // draw curve fill:
17048  if (mainBrush().style() != Qt::NoBrush && mainBrush().color().alpha() != 0)
17049  {
17050  applyFillAntialiasingHint(painter);
17051  painter->setPen(Qt::NoPen);
17052  painter->setBrush(mainBrush());
17053  painter->drawPolygon(QPolygonF(*lineData));
17054  }
17055 
17056  // draw curve line:
17057  if (mLineStyle != lsNone && mainPen().style() != Qt::NoPen && mainPen().color().alpha() != 0)
17058  {
17059  applyDefaultAntialiasingHint(painter);
17060  painter->setPen(mainPen());
17061  painter->setBrush(Qt::NoBrush);
17062  // if drawing solid line and not in PDF, use much faster line drawing instead of polyline:
17063  if (mParentPlot->plottingHints().testFlag(QCP::phFastPolylines) &&
17064  painter->pen().style() == Qt::SolidLine &&
17065  !painter->modes().testFlag(QCPPainter::pmVectorized) &&
17066  !painter->modes().testFlag(QCPPainter::pmNoCaching))
17067  {
17068  for (int i=1; i<lineData->size(); ++i)
17069  painter->drawLine(lineData->at(i-1), lineData->at(i));
17070  } else
17071  {
17072  painter->drawPolyline(QPolygonF(*lineData));
17073  }
17074  }
17075 
17076  // draw scatters:
17077  if (!mScatterStyle.isNone())
17078  drawScatterPlot(painter, lineData);
17079 
17080  // free allocated line data:
17081  delete lineData;
17082 }
17083 
17084 /* inherits documentation from base class */
17085 void QCPCurve::drawLegendIcon(QCPPainter *painter, const QRectF &rect) const
17086 {
17087  // draw fill:
17088  if (mBrush.style() != Qt::NoBrush)
17089  {
17090  applyFillAntialiasingHint(painter);
17091  painter->fillRect(QRectF(rect.left(), rect.top()+rect.height()/2.0, rect.width(), rect.height()/3.0), mBrush);
17092  }
17093  // draw line vertically centered:
17094  if (mLineStyle != lsNone)
17095  {
17096  applyDefaultAntialiasingHint(painter);
17097  painter->setPen(mPen);
17098  painter->drawLine(QLineF(rect.left(), rect.top()+rect.height()/2.0, rect.right()+5, rect.top()+rect.height()/2.0)); // +5 on x2 else last segment is missing from dashed/dotted pens
17099  }
17100  // draw scatter symbol:
17101  if (!mScatterStyle.isNone())
17102  {
17103  applyScattersAntialiasingHint(painter);
17104  // scale scatter pixmap if it's too large to fit in legend icon rect:
17105  if (mScatterStyle.shape() == QCPScatterStyle::ssPixmap && (mScatterStyle.pixmap().size().width() > rect.width() || mScatterStyle.pixmap().size().height() > rect.height()))
17106  {
17107  QCPScatterStyle scaledStyle(mScatterStyle);
17108  scaledStyle.setPixmap(scaledStyle.pixmap().scaled(rect.size().toSize(), Qt::KeepAspectRatio, Qt::SmoothTransformation));
17109  scaledStyle.applyTo(painter, mPen);
17110  scaledStyle.drawShape(painter, QRectF(rect).center());
17111  } else
17112  {
17113  mScatterStyle.applyTo(painter, mPen);
17114  mScatterStyle.drawShape(painter, QRectF(rect).center());
17115  }
17116  }
17117 }
17118 
17124 void QCPCurve::drawScatterPlot(QCPPainter *painter, const QVector<QPointF> *pointData) const
17125 {
17126  // draw scatter point symbols:
17127  applyScattersAntialiasingHint(painter);
17128  mScatterStyle.applyTo(painter, mPen);
17129  for (int i=0; i<pointData->size(); ++i)
17130  mScatterStyle.drawShape(painter, pointData->at(i));
17131 }
17132 
17139 void QCPCurve::getCurveData(QVector<QPointF> *lineData) const
17140 {
17141  /* Extended sides of axis rect R divide space into 9 regions:
17142  1__|_4_|__7
17143  2__|_R_|__8
17144  3 | 6 | 9
17145  General idea: If the two points of a line segment are in the same region (that is not R), the line segment corner is removed.
17146  Curves outside R become straight lines closely outside of R which greatly reduces drawing time, yet keeps the look of lines and
17147  fills inside R consistent.
17148  The region R has index 5.
17149  */
17150  QCPAxis *keyAxis = mKeyAxis.data();
17151  QCPAxis *valueAxis = mValueAxis.data();
17152  if (!keyAxis || !valueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return; }
17153 
17154  QRect axisRect = mKeyAxis.data()->axisRect()->rect() & mValueAxis.data()->axisRect()->rect();
17155  lineData->reserve(mData->size());
17156  QCPCurveDataMap::const_iterator it;
17157  int lastRegion = 5;
17158  int currentRegion = 5;
17159  double RLeft = keyAxis->range().lower;
17160  double RRight = keyAxis->range().upper;
17161  double RBottom = valueAxis->range().lower;
17162  double RTop = valueAxis->range().upper;
17163  double x, y; // current key/value
17164  bool addedLastAlready = true;
17165  bool firstPoint = true; // first point must always be drawn, to make sure fill works correctly
17166  for (it = mData->constBegin(); it != mData->constEnd(); ++it)
17167  {
17168  x = it.value().key;
17169  y = it.value().value;
17170  // determine current region:
17171  if (x < RLeft) // region 123
17172  {
17173  if (y > RTop)
17174  currentRegion = 1;
17175  else if (y < RBottom)
17176  currentRegion = 3;
17177  else
17178  currentRegion = 2;
17179  } else if (x > RRight) // region 789
17180  {
17181  if (y > RTop)
17182  currentRegion = 7;
17183  else if (y < RBottom)
17184  currentRegion = 9;
17185  else
17186  currentRegion = 8;
17187  } else // region 456
17188  {
17189  if (y > RTop)
17190  currentRegion = 4;
17191  else if (y < RBottom)
17192  currentRegion = 6;
17193  else
17194  currentRegion = 5;
17195  }
17196 
17197  /*
17198  Watch out, the next part is very tricky. It modifies the curve such that it seems like the
17199  whole thing is still drawn, but actually the points outside the axisRect are simplified
17200  ("optimized") greatly. There are some subtle special cases when line segments are large and
17201  thereby each subsequent point may be in a different region or even skip some.
17202  */
17203  // determine whether to keep current point:
17204  if (currentRegion == 5 || (firstPoint && mBrush.style() != Qt::NoBrush)) // current is in R, add current and last if it wasn't added already
17205  {
17206  if (!addedLastAlready) // in case curve just entered R, make sure the last point outside R is also drawn correctly
17207  lineData->append(coordsToPixels((it-1).value().key, (it-1).value().value)); // add last point to vector
17208  else if (lastRegion != 5) // added last already. If that's the case, we probably added it at optimized position. So go back and make sure it's at original position (else the angle changes under which this segment enters R)
17209  {
17210  if (!firstPoint) // because on firstPoint, currentRegion is 5 and addedLastAlready is true, although there is no last point
17211  lineData->replace(lineData->size()-1, coordsToPixels((it-1).value().key, (it-1).value().value));
17212  }
17213  lineData->append(coordsToPixels(it.value().key, it.value().value)); // add current point to vector
17214  addedLastAlready = true; // so in next iteration, we don't add this point twice
17215  } else if (currentRegion != lastRegion) // changed region, add current and last if not added already
17216  {
17217  // using outsideCoordsToPixels instead of coorsToPixels for optimized point placement (places points just outside axisRect instead of potentially far away)
17218 
17219  // if we're coming from R or we skip diagonally over the corner regions (so line might still be visible in R), we can't place points optimized
17220  if (lastRegion == 5 || // coming from R
17221  ((lastRegion==2 && currentRegion==4) || (lastRegion==4 && currentRegion==2)) || // skip top left diagonal
17222  ((lastRegion==4 && currentRegion==8) || (lastRegion==8 && currentRegion==4)) || // skip top right diagonal
17223  ((lastRegion==8 && currentRegion==6) || (lastRegion==6 && currentRegion==8)) || // skip bottom right diagonal
17224  ((lastRegion==6 && currentRegion==2) || (lastRegion==2 && currentRegion==6)) // skip bottom left diagonal
17225  )
17226  {
17227  // always add last point if not added already, original:
17228  if (!addedLastAlready)
17229  lineData->append(coordsToPixels((it-1).value().key, (it-1).value().value));
17230  // add current point, original:
17231  lineData->append(coordsToPixels(it.value().key, it.value().value));
17232  } else // no special case that forbids optimized point placement, so do it:
17233  {
17234  // always add last point if not added already, optimized:
17235  if (!addedLastAlready)
17236  lineData->append(outsideCoordsToPixels((it-1).value().key, (it-1).value().value, currentRegion, axisRect));
17237  // add current point, optimized:
17238  lineData->append(outsideCoordsToPixels(it.value().key, it.value().value, currentRegion, axisRect));
17239  }
17240  addedLastAlready = true; // so that if next point enters 5, or crosses another region boundary, we don't add this point twice
17241  } else // neither in R, nor crossed a region boundary, skip current point
17242  {
17243  addedLastAlready = false;
17244  }
17245  lastRegion = currentRegion;
17246  firstPoint = false;
17247  }
17248  // If curve ends outside R, we want to add very last point so the fill looks like it should when the curve started inside R:
17249  if (lastRegion != 5 && mBrush.style() != Qt::NoBrush && !mData->isEmpty())
17250  lineData->append(coordsToPixels((mData->constEnd()-1).value().key, (mData->constEnd()-1).value().value));
17251 }
17252 
17259 double QCPCurve::pointDistance(const QPointF &pixelPoint) const
17260 {
17261  if (mData->isEmpty())
17262  {
17263  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "requested point distance on curve" << mName << "without data";
17264  return 500;
17265  }
17266  if (mData->size() == 1)
17267  {
17268  QPointF dataPoint = coordsToPixels(mData->constBegin().key(), mData->constBegin().value().value);
17269  return QVector2D(dataPoint-pixelPoint).length();
17270  }
17271 
17272  // calculate minimum distance to line segments:
17273  QVector<QPointF> *lineData = new QVector<QPointF>;
17274  getCurveData(lineData);
17275  double minDistSqr = std::numeric_limits<double>::max();
17276  for (int i=0; i<lineData->size()-1; ++i)
17277  {
17278  double currentDistSqr = distSqrToLine(lineData->at(i), lineData->at(i+1), pixelPoint);
17279  if (currentDistSqr < minDistSqr)
17280  minDistSqr = currentDistSqr;
17281  }
17282  delete lineData;
17283  return sqrt(minDistSqr);
17284 }
17285 
17297 QPointF QCPCurve::outsideCoordsToPixels(double key, double value, int region, QRect axisRect) const
17298 {
17299  int margin = qCeil(qMax(mScatterStyle.size(), (double)mPen.widthF())) + 2;
17300  QPointF result = coordsToPixels(key, value);
17301  switch (region)
17302  {
17303  case 2: result.setX(axisRect.left()-margin); break; // left
17304  case 8: result.setX(axisRect.right()+margin); break; // right
17305  case 4: result.setY(axisRect.top()-margin); break; // top
17306  case 6: result.setY(axisRect.bottom()+margin); break; // bottom
17307  case 1: result.setX(axisRect.left()-margin);
17308  result.setY(axisRect.top()-margin); break; // top left
17309  case 7: result.setX(axisRect.right()+margin);
17310  result.setY(axisRect.top()-margin); break; // top right
17311  case 9: result.setX(axisRect.right()+margin);
17312  result.setY(axisRect.bottom()+margin); break; // bottom right
17313  case 3: result.setX(axisRect.left()-margin);
17314  result.setY(axisRect.bottom()+margin); break; // bottom left
17315  }
17316  return result;
17317 }
17318 
17319 /* inherits documentation from base class */
17320 QCPRange QCPCurve::getKeyRange(bool &foundRange, SignDomain inSignDomain) const
17321 {
17322  QCPRange range;
17323  bool haveLower = false;
17324  bool haveUpper = false;
17325 
17326  double current;
17327 
17328  QCPCurveDataMap::const_iterator it = mData->constBegin();
17329  while (it != mData->constEnd())
17330  {
17331  current = it.value().key;
17332  if (inSignDomain == sdBoth || (inSignDomain == sdNegative && current < 0) || (inSignDomain == sdPositive && current > 0))
17333  {
17334  if (current < range.lower || !haveLower)
17335  {
17336  range.lower = current;
17337  haveLower = true;
17338  }
17339  if (current > range.upper || !haveUpper)
17340  {
17341  range.upper = current;
17342  haveUpper = true;
17343  }
17344  }
17345  ++it;
17346  }
17347 
17348  foundRange = haveLower && haveUpper;
17349  return range;
17350 }
17351 
17352 /* inherits documentation from base class */
17353 QCPRange QCPCurve::getValueRange(bool &foundRange, SignDomain inSignDomain) const
17354 {
17355  QCPRange range;
17356  bool haveLower = false;
17357  bool haveUpper = false;
17358 
17359  double current;
17360 
17361  QCPCurveDataMap::const_iterator it = mData->constBegin();
17362  while (it != mData->constEnd())
17363  {
17364  current = it.value().value;
17365  if (inSignDomain == sdBoth || (inSignDomain == sdNegative && current < 0) || (inSignDomain == sdPositive && current > 0))
17366  {
17367  if (current < range.lower || !haveLower)
17368  {
17369  range.lower = current;
17370  haveLower = true;
17371  }
17372  if (current > range.upper || !haveUpper)
17373  {
17374  range.upper = current;
17375  haveUpper = true;
17376  }
17377  }
17378  ++it;
17379  }
17380 
17381  foundRange = haveLower && haveUpper;
17382  return range;
17383 }
17384

17389 
17405 QCPBarData::QCPBarData() :
17406  key(0),
17407  value(0)
17408 {
17409 }
17410 
17414 QCPBarData::QCPBarData(double key, double value) :
17415  key(key),
17416  value(value)
17417 {
17418 }
17419 
17420 
17424 
17481 QCPBars::QCPBars(QCPAxis *keyAxis, QCPAxis *valueAxis) :
17482  QCPAbstractPlottable(keyAxis, valueAxis)
17483 {
17484  mData = new QCPBarDataMap;
17485  mPen.setColor(Qt::blue);
17486  mPen.setStyle(Qt::SolidLine);
17487  mBrush.setColor(QColor(40, 50, 255, 30));
17488  mBrush.setStyle(Qt::SolidPattern);
17489  mSelectedPen = mPen;
17490  mSelectedPen.setWidthF(2.5);
17491  mSelectedPen.setColor(QColor(80, 80, 255)); // lighter than Qt::blue of mPen
17492  mSelectedBrush = mBrush;
17493 
17494  mWidth = 0.75;
17495 }
17496 
17497 QCPBars::~QCPBars()
17498 {
17499  if (mBarBelow || mBarAbove)
17500  connectBars(mBarBelow.data(), mBarAbove.data()); // take this bar out of any stacking
17501  delete mData;
17502 }
17503 
17507 void QCPBars::setWidth(double width)
17508 {
17509  mWidth = width;
17510 }
17511 
17519 void QCPBars::setData(QCPBarDataMap *data, bool copy)
17520 {
17521  if (copy)
17522  {
17523  *mData = *data;
17524  } else
17525  {
17526  delete mData;
17527  mData = data;
17528  }
17529 }
17530 
17537 void QCPBars::setData(const QVector<double> &key, const QVector<double> &value)
17538 {
17539  mData->clear();
17540  int n = key.size();
17541  n = qMin(n, value.size());
17542  QCPBarData newData;
17543  for (int i=0; i<n; ++i)
17544  {
17545  newData.key = key[i];
17546  newData.value = value[i];
17547  mData->insertMulti(newData.key, newData);
17548  }
17549 }
17550 
17565 void QCPBars::moveBelow(QCPBars *bars)
17566 {
17567  if (bars == this) return;
17568  if (bars && (bars->keyAxis() != mKeyAxis.data() || bars->valueAxis() != mValueAxis.data()))
17569  {
17570  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "passed QCPBars* doesn't have same key and value axis as this QCPBars";
17571  return;
17572  }
17573  // remove from stacking:
17574  connectBars(mBarBelow.data(), mBarAbove.data()); // Note: also works if one (or both) of them is 0
17575  // if new bar given, insert this bar below it:
17576  if (bars)
17577  {
17578  if (bars->mBarBelow)
17579  connectBars(bars->mBarBelow.data(), this);
17580  connectBars(this, bars);
17581  }
17582 }
17583 
17598 void QCPBars::moveAbove(QCPBars *bars)
17599 {
17600  if (bars == this) return;
17601  if (bars && (bars->keyAxis() != mKeyAxis.data() || bars->valueAxis() != mValueAxis.data()))
17602  {
17603  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "passed QCPBars* doesn't have same key and value axis as this QCPBars";
17604  return;
17605  }
17606  // remove from stacking:
17607  connectBars(mBarBelow.data(), mBarAbove.data()); // Note: also works if one (or both) of them is 0
17608  // if new bar given, insert this bar above it:
17609  if (bars)
17610  {
17611  if (bars->mBarAbove)
17612  connectBars(this, bars->mBarAbove.data());
17613  connectBars(bars, this);
17614  }
17615 }
17616 
17621 void QCPBars::addData(const QCPBarDataMap &dataMap)
17622 {
17623  mData->unite(dataMap);
17624 }
17625 
17630 void QCPBars::addData(const QCPBarData &data)
17631 {
17632  mData->insertMulti(data.key, data);
17633 }
17634 
17639 void QCPBars::addData(double key, double value)
17640 {
17641  QCPBarData newData;
17642  newData.key = key;
17643  newData.value = value;
17644  mData->insertMulti(newData.key, newData);
17645 }
17646 
17651 void QCPBars::addData(const QVector<double> &keys, const QVector<double> &values)
17652 {
17653  int n = keys.size();
17654  n = qMin(n, values.size());
17655  QCPBarData newData;
17656  for (int i=0; i<n; ++i)
17657  {
17658  newData.key = keys[i];
17659  newData.value = values[i];
17660  mData->insertMulti(newData.key, newData);
17661  }
17662 }
17663 
17668 void QCPBars::removeDataBefore(double key)
17669 {
17670  QCPBarDataMap::iterator it = mData->begin();
17671  while (it != mData->end() && it.key() < key)
17672  it = mData->erase(it);
17673 }
17674 
17679 void QCPBars::removeDataAfter(double key)
17680 {
17681  if (mData->isEmpty()) return;
17682  QCPBarDataMap::iterator it = mData->upperBound(key);
17683  while (it != mData->end())
17684  it = mData->erase(it);
17685 }
17686 
17694 void QCPBars::removeData(double fromKey, double toKey)
17695 {
17696  if (fromKey >= toKey || mData->isEmpty()) return;
17697  QCPBarDataMap::iterator it = mData->upperBound(fromKey);
17698  QCPBarDataMap::iterator itEnd = mData->upperBound(toKey);
17699  while (it != itEnd)
17700  it = mData->erase(it);
17701 }
17702 
17711 void QCPBars::removeData(double key)
17712 {
17713  mData->remove(key);
17714 }
17715 
17720 void QCPBars::clearData()
17721 {
17722  mData->clear();
17723 }
17724 
17725 /* inherits documentation from base class */
17726 double QCPBars::selectTest(const QPointF &pos, bool onlySelectable, QVariant *details) const
17727 {
17728  Q_UNUSED(details)
17729  if (onlySelectable && !mSelectable)
17730  return -1;
17731  if (!mKeyAxis || !mValueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return -1; }
17732 
17733  if (mKeyAxis.data()->axisRect()->rect().contains(pos.toPoint()))
17734  {
17735  QCPBarDataMap::ConstIterator it;
17736  double posKey, posValue;
17737  pixelsToCoords(pos, posKey, posValue);
17738  for (it = mData->constBegin(); it != mData->constEnd(); ++it)
17739  {
17740  double baseValue = getBaseValue(it.key(), it.value().value >=0);
17741  QCPRange keyRange(it.key()-mWidth*0.5, it.key()+mWidth*0.5);
17742  QCPRange valueRange(baseValue, baseValue+it.value().value);
17743  if (keyRange.contains(posKey) && valueRange.contains(posValue))
17744  return mParentPlot->selectionTolerance()*0.99;
17745  }
17746  }
17747  return -1;
17748 }
17749 
17750 /* inherits documentation from base class */
17751 void QCPBars::draw(QCPPainter *painter)
17752 {
17753  if (!mKeyAxis || !mValueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return; }
17754  if (mData->isEmpty()) return;
17755 
17756  QCPBarDataMap::const_iterator it;
17757  for (it = mData->constBegin(); it != mData->constEnd(); ++it)
17758  {
17759  // skip bar if not visible in key axis range:
17760  if (it.key()+mWidth*0.5 < mKeyAxis.data()->range().lower || it.key()-mWidth*0.5 > mKeyAxis.data()->range().upper)
17761  continue;
17762  // check data validity if flag set:
17763 #ifdef QCUSTOMPLOT_CHECK_DATA
17764  if (QCP::isInvalidData(it.value().key, it.value().value))
17765  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "Data point at" << it.key() << "of drawn range invalid." << "Plottable name:" << name();
17766 #endif
17767  QPolygonF barPolygon = getBarPolygon(it.key(), it.value().value);
17768  // draw bar fill:
17769  if (mainBrush().style() != Qt::NoBrush && mainBrush().color().alpha() != 0)
17770  {
17771  applyFillAntialiasingHint(painter);
17772  painter->setPen(Qt::NoPen);
17773  painter->setBrush(mainBrush());
17774  painter->drawPolygon(barPolygon);
17775  }
17776  // draw bar line:
17777  if (mainPen().style() != Qt::NoPen && mainPen().color().alpha() != 0)
17778  {
17779  applyDefaultAntialiasingHint(painter);
17780  painter->setPen(mainPen());
17781  painter->setBrush(Qt::NoBrush);
17782  painter->drawPolyline(barPolygon);
17783  }
17784  }
17785 }
17786 
17787 /* inherits documentation from base class */
17788 void QCPBars::drawLegendIcon(QCPPainter *painter, const QRectF &rect) const
17789 {
17790  // draw filled rect:
17791  applyDefaultAntialiasingHint(painter);
17792  painter->setBrush(mBrush);
17793  painter->setPen(mPen);
17794  QRectF r = QRectF(0, 0, rect.width()*0.67, rect.height()*0.67);
17795  r.moveCenter(rect.center());
17796  painter->drawRect(r);
17797 }
17798 
17804 QPolygonF QCPBars::getBarPolygon(double key, double value) const
17805 {
17806  QPolygonF result;
17807  double baseValue = getBaseValue(key, value >= 0);
17808  result << coordsToPixels(key-mWidth*0.5, baseValue);
17809  result << coordsToPixels(key-mWidth*0.5, baseValue+value);
17810  result << coordsToPixels(key+mWidth*0.5, baseValue+value);
17811  result << coordsToPixels(key+mWidth*0.5, baseValue);
17812  return result;
17813 }
17814 
17824 double QCPBars::getBaseValue(double key, bool positive) const
17825 {
17826  if (mBarBelow)
17827  {
17828  double max = 0;
17829  // find bars of mBarBelow that are approximately at key and find largest one:
17830  QCPBarDataMap::const_iterator it = mBarBelow.data()->mData->lowerBound(key-mWidth*0.1);
17831  QCPBarDataMap::const_iterator itEnd = mBarBelow.data()->mData->upperBound(key+mWidth*0.1);
17832  while (it != itEnd)
17833  {
17834  if ((positive && it.value().value > max) ||
17835  (!positive && it.value().value < max))
17836  max = it.value().value;
17837  ++it;
17838  }
17839  // recurse down the bar-stack to find the total height:
17840  return max + mBarBelow.data()->getBaseValue(key, positive);
17841  } else
17842  return 0;
17843 }
17844 
17853 void QCPBars::connectBars(QCPBars *lower, QCPBars *upper)
17854 {
17855  if (!lower && !upper) return;
17856 
17857  if (!lower) // disconnect upper at bottom
17858  {
17859  // disconnect old bar below upper:
17860  if (upper->mBarBelow && upper->mBarBelow.data()->mBarAbove.data() == upper)
17861  upper->mBarBelow.data()->mBarAbove = 0;
17862  upper->mBarBelow = 0;
17863  } else if (!upper) // disconnect lower at top
17864  {
17865  // disconnect old bar above lower:
17866  if (lower->mBarAbove && lower->mBarAbove.data()->mBarBelow.data() == lower)
17867  lower->mBarAbove.data()->mBarBelow = 0;
17868  lower->mBarAbove = 0;
17869  } else // connect lower and upper
17870  {
17871  // disconnect old bar above lower:
17872  if (lower->mBarAbove && lower->mBarAbove.data()->mBarBelow.data() == lower)
17873  lower->mBarAbove.data()->mBarBelow = 0;
17874  // disconnect old bar below upper:
17875  if (upper->mBarBelow && upper->mBarBelow.data()->mBarAbove.data() == upper)
17876  upper->mBarBelow.data()->mBarAbove = 0;
17877  lower->mBarAbove = upper;
17878  upper->mBarBelow = lower;
17879  }
17880 }
17881 
17882 /* inherits documentation from base class */
17883 QCPRange QCPBars::getKeyRange(bool &foundRange, SignDomain inSignDomain) const
17884 {
17885  QCPRange range;
17886  bool haveLower = false;
17887  bool haveUpper = false;
17888 
17889  double current;
17890  double barWidthHalf = mWidth*0.5;
17891  QCPBarDataMap::const_iterator it = mData->constBegin();
17892  while (it != mData->constEnd())
17893  {
17894  current = it.value().key;
17895  if (inSignDomain == sdBoth || (inSignDomain == sdNegative && current+barWidthHalf < 0) || (inSignDomain == sdPositive && current-barWidthHalf > 0))
17896  {
17897  if (current-barWidthHalf < range.lower || !haveLower)
17898  {
17899  range.lower = current-barWidthHalf;
17900  haveLower = true;
17901  }
17902  if (current+barWidthHalf > range.upper || !haveUpper)
17903  {
17904  range.upper = current+barWidthHalf;
17905  haveUpper = true;
17906  }
17907  }
17908  ++it;
17909  }
17910 
17911  foundRange = haveLower && haveUpper;
17912  return range;
17913 }
17914 
17915 /* inherits documentation from base class */
17916 QCPRange QCPBars::getValueRange(bool &foundRange, SignDomain inSignDomain) const
17917 {
17918  QCPRange range;
17919  bool haveLower = true; // set to true, because 0 should always be visible in bar charts
17920  bool haveUpper = true; // set to true, because 0 should always be visible in bar charts
17921 
17922  double current;
17923 
17924  QCPBarDataMap::const_iterator it = mData->constBegin();
17925  while (it != mData->constEnd())
17926  {
17927  current = it.value().value + getBaseValue(it.value().key, it.value().value >= 0);
17928  if (inSignDomain == sdBoth || (inSignDomain == sdNegative && current < 0) || (inSignDomain == sdPositive && current > 0))
17929  {
17930  if (current < range.lower || !haveLower)
17931  {
17932  range.lower = current;
17933  haveLower = true;
17934  }
17935  if (current > range.upper || !haveUpper)
17936  {
17937  range.upper = current;
17938  haveUpper = true;
17939  }
17940  }
17941  ++it;
17942  }
17943 
17944  foundRange = true; // return true because bar charts always have the 0-line visible
17945  return range;
17946 }
17947 
17948 
17952 
18015 QCPStatisticalBox::QCPStatisticalBox(QCPAxis *keyAxis, QCPAxis *valueAxis) :
18016  QCPAbstractPlottable(keyAxis, valueAxis),
18017  mKey(0),
18018  mMinimum(0),
18019  mLowerQuartile(0),
18020  mMedian(0),
18021  mUpperQuartile(0),
18022  mMaximum(0)
18023 {
18024  setOutlierStyle(QCPScatterStyle(QCPScatterStyle::ssCircle, Qt::blue, 6));
18025  setWhiskerWidth(0.2);
18026  setWidth(0.5);
18027 
18028  setPen(QPen(Qt::black));
18029  setSelectedPen(QPen(Qt::blue, 2.5));
18030  setMedianPen(QPen(Qt::black, 3, Qt::SolidLine, Qt::FlatCap));
18031  setWhiskerPen(QPen(Qt::black, 0, Qt::DashLine, Qt::FlatCap));
18032  setWhiskerBarPen(QPen(Qt::black));
18033  setBrush(Qt::NoBrush);
18034  setSelectedBrush(Qt::NoBrush);
18035 }
18036 
18040 void QCPStatisticalBox::setKey(double key)
18041 {
18042  mKey = key;
18043 }

18052 {

18054 }

18064 {
18065  mLowerQuartile = value;
18066 }

18075 void QCPStatisticalBox::setMedian(double value)
18076 {
18077  mMedian = value;
18078 }
18079 
18087 void QCPStatisticalBox::setUpperQuartile(double value)
18088 {
18089  mUpperQuartile = value;
18090 }
18091 
18098 void QCPStatisticalBox::setMaximum(double value)
18099 {
18100  mMaximum = value;
18101 }
18102 
18110 void QCPStatisticalBox::setOutliers(const QVector<double> &values)
18111 {
18112  mOutliers = values;
18113 }
18114 
18120 void QCPStatisticalBox::setData(double key, double minimum, double lowerQuartile, double median, double upperQuartile, double maximum)
18121 {
18122  setKey(key);
18123  setMinimum(minimum);
18124  setLowerQuartile(lowerQuartile);
18125  setMedian(median);
18126  setUpperQuartile(upperQuartile);
18127  setMaximum(maximum);
18128 }

18136 {
18137  mWidth = width;
18138 }

18145 void QCPStatisticalBox::setWhiskerWidth(double width)
18146 {
18147  mWhiskerWidth = width;
18148 }
18149 
18158 void QCPStatisticalBox::setWhiskerPen(const QPen &pen)
18159 {
18160  mWhiskerPen = pen;
18161 }
18162 
18169 void QCPStatisticalBox::setWhiskerBarPen(const QPen &pen)
18170 {
18171  mWhiskerBarPen = pen;
18172 }
